text.author: Barbara McMahon
text.description: It should have come as no surprise to the people of Finland that Silvio Berlusconi put his foot in it with their president.
text.title: Berlusconi's flirty words about EU food standards

main.p: He has branded Italian magistrates mad men, likened a German MEP to a Nazi and offended Jews in his home country and abroad.
So it should have come as no surprise to the people of Finland that Silvio Berlusconi might put his foot in it with their president.
The two countries were yesterday trying to untangle the Italian prime minister's latest diplomatic gaffe, which he contrived from the seemingly innocuous issue of the EU's food standards agency.

Mr Berlusconi said he had persuaded president Tarja Halonen that it should be based in Italy, and suggested that he had flirted and charmed her into making the decision. "When you seek a result it is necessary to use all available weapons and therefore I brushed up all my playboy skills and I used a series of tender pleas to the president," he said.
For good measure, he then made a derogatory remark about food in Finland, singling out smoked herring.
The Finnish president was not amused. Italy's ambassador in Helsinki was summoned to explain the remarks and receive an official rebuke.
Politicians and the media in both countries have now weighed in.
In Italy, Renzo Lusetti of the Margherita party called it "another Berlusconi own goal", while lawmaker Antonio Pietro described the remarks as "inappropriate".

According to the Ilta-Sanomat newspaper in Finland, hundreds of readers had sent in emails calling the remarks sexist while Lasse Lehtinen, a Finnish social democrat MP, speculated that Mr Berlusconi's recent facelift "may have affected his brain".
Most Italians have been splitting their sides and writer Natalian Aspesi said in La Repubblica newspaper that Italians had more important things to worry about, such as the economy.
Mr Berlusconi's spokesman said the comments were "light-hearted and a way of expressing friendliness".
